titlepage.titleproper: Inventory of the Emily Harrell Lynch Papers, 1938-1946
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in the
Special Collections Research Center UA 5.040
titlepage.publisher: Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary

archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: This collection consists of twenty-seven photographs and four newspaper clippings all belonging to Emily Harrell Lynch, College of William and Mary class of 1942. Typical student activities are documented including sports such as football and Homecoming Parades, May Day, Christmas, initiations, College buildings, and other typical college activities. Box 1 contains the newspaper clippings and box 2 contains the photographs.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Before reproducing or quoting from any materials, in whole or in part, permission must be obtained from the Special Collections Research Center, and the holder of the copyright, if not Swem Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Emily Harrell Lynch Papers, Special Collections Research Center, Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The materials were acquired by Special Collections Research Center from Gift of Emily Harrell Lynch on 07/27/1990.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: William and Mary student (1938-1942).  Further information about this individual or organization may be available in the Special Collections Research Center Wiki: http://scrc.swem.wm.edu/wiki/index.php/Emily Harrell Lynch.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of twenty-seven photographs and four newspaper clippings all belonging to Emily Harrell Lynch, College of William and Mary class of 1942. Typical student activities are documented including sports such as football and Homecoming Parades, May Day, Christmas, initiations, College buildings, and other typical college activities. Box 1 contains the newspaper clippings and box 2 contains the photographs.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: One gray, green, and gold duc cap, circa 1938, is housed and described in the University Archives Artifact Collection.See various subject files under Athletics--Indian Symbolism and Athletics--Football in the University Archives Subject File Collection.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: One gray, green, and gold duc cap, circa 1938, was separated from this collection and is now housed and described in the University Archives Artifact Collection.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: This Collection is indexed under the following controlled access subject terms.
